visualization_prompt: Generate a boxplot showing distribution statistics with configurable whisker lengths using Highcharts customization
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains three boxplot distributions with synthetic statistics demonstrating different whisker configurations. Each data point represents a quintessential boxplot structure (low, Q1, median, Q3, high) with normal distribution characteristics (μ=40, σ=15). Values maintain domain consistency for experimental measurements (range: 12.4-68.2). The boxplot format maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating non-essential elements while preserving Tukey's five-number summary. Cairo's principles are applied through pre-attentive color coding (#e74c3c) and proportional whisker lengths. Configuration demonstrates: 1) Symmetric 50% whiskers (x=0), 2) Extended lower whisker (x=1), and 3) Truncated upper whisker (x=2), providing clear visual differentiation of dispersion characteristics.
